alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 8:13AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN ERIE COUNTY... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour. Winds will also increase late this morning, resulting in areas of blowing snow. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 811 AM EST, a lake effect snow band was over Buffalo and Cheektowaga. The lake effect snow will continue to drift slowly north Tonawanda through late morning. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Williamsville, Small Boat Harbor, Erie Basin Marina, Clarence Center, and East Amherst. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 54. SAFETY INFO... The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. &&
